N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 352.26 - Life insurance

State Regulations
(a) When an insurance policy has been
assigned to the agency, the agency shall pay the premiums thereon unless it
elects to take the paid-up value of the policy. (b) When the agency is the assignee of the
insurance policy, upon the death of the insured, the amount released for burial
expenses shall be determined by the existing burial allowance. After deduction
of such amount for burial expenses, any balance remaining, up to the amount of
the cost of assistance and care rendered to the deceased, shall be taken by the
agency for reimbursement, except, when the deceased leaves surviving him any
relatives for whom he had been legally responsible and who are, or who are
liable to become, public charges, the agency may release such balance to such
relatives of the deceased. Notes
